com.milk.objed
Class TextEditor

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.milk.objed.BaseWrappedValueEditor
        |
        +--com.milk.objed.TextEditor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Editable, Editor, ValueEditor
Direct Known Subclasses:
IntegerTextEditor, StringTextEditor
public abstract class TextEditor
extends BaseWrappedValueEditor

This class is an editor which wraps around a ValueEditor, only allowing for getting and setting as a text string. The underlying value isn't necessarily a String; for example, IntegerTextEditor (a subclass of this class) is for editing an Integer value as text.

This class knows about minimum, maximum, and preferred (for presentation) lengths of the text. The following are restrictions on those values: maximumLength and preferredLength may be NONE to indicate that there is no maximum or preferred length (respectively). It is illegal for maximumLength to be smaller than minimumLength. preferredLength, if not NONE, must be between minimumLength and maximumLength. Aside from the special value NONE, all the parameters must be non-negative.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

Constructor Detail

TextEditor

protected TextEditor(ValueEditor target)
Construct a TextEditor. It is initially set to have no minimum, maximum, or preferred length, but that can be changed with the setLengths() method. Also, if password-style hidden text is needed, use setHidden().

Parameters:
target - the target for getting and setting
Method Detail

getMinimumLength

public final int getMinimumLength()
Get the minimum length that the text will ever be.

Returns:
the minimum length

getMaximumLength

public final int getMaximumLength()
Get the maximum length that the text will ever be. This returns TextEditor.NONE if there is no maximum.

Returns:
the maximum length

getPreferredLength

public final int getPreferredLength()
Get the preferred length for a field displaying the text in this editor. This returns TextEditor.NONE if there is no preferred length.

Returns:
the preferred length

getHidden

public final boolean getHidden()
Get whether or not the text should be hidden, as in password entry.

Returns:
true if the text should be hidden

Parameters:
hideText - true if the text should be hidden

getValue

public final java.lang.Object getValue()
                                throws BadValueException
Get the text value of this editor. This will only ever return a string whose length is between getMinimumLength() and getMaximumLength.

Specified by:
getValue in interface ValueEditor
Overrides:
getValue in class BaseWrappedValueEditor
Returns:
the text value
Throws:
BadValueException - thrown if the value is bad in some way

setValue

public final void setValue(java.lang.Object value)
                    throws BadValueException,
                           ImmutableException
Set the text value of this editor. This will only ever accept a string as an argument, and only if the length is between getMinimumLength() and getMaximumLength.

Specified by:
setValue in interface ValueEditor
Overrides:
setValue in class BaseWrappedValueEditor
Parameters:

Throws:

ImmutableException - thrown if the editor is in fact immutable

setLengths

protected final void setLengths(int minimumLength,
                                int maximumLength,
                                int preferredLength)
Set the minimum, maximum, and preferred lengths for this text editor.

Parameters:
minimumLength - the minimum allowed textual length of the editor
maximumLength - the maximum allowed textual length of the editor
preferredLength - the preferred presentation length of the editor
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the lengths do not abide by the restrictions as specified in the description of this class

valueToText

protected abstract java.lang.String valueToText(java.lang.Object value)
Turn the given value into its text form. The value is on its way out of a getValue(). It is okay to throw BadValueException if the value is inappropriate.

Parameters:
value - the value to process
Returns:
the text form of the value
Throws:

Parameters:
